intro: Citharexylum mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican citharexylum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and showy, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glandular surface, while its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
